title.narrative: Vietnam Bank for Industry and Trade

description.narrative: The Project will achieve a strong development impact by demonstrating IFCs commitment in supporting Vietnam financial market reform, including the following: improving the capital adequacy of the third largest local bank which is of systemic importance for Vietnam. The project will demonstrate IFCs continued commitment to Vietnams financial market through assisting the state- owned bank to increase its capital to meet business expansion needs and pursue its privatization and modernization plan amid global financial turmoil. focusing on SME lending; IFCs investment will assist the Bank to expand its SME loan portfolio to reach clients through its wide network in all cities and provinces of Vietnam, thus supporting employment generation, livelihood improvement and private sector growth.

Vietnam Joint Stock Commercial Bank for Industry and Trade (Vietinbank or the Bank) is the third largest bank in Vietnam with credit market share of approximately 11.6%. Established in 1988, Vietinbank is headquartered in Hanoi, and has four subsidiaries in leasing, securities, insurance and assets management. It provides a full range of banking services including corporate and SME banking, retail and consumer banking and international banking services. The Bank completed its IPO in December 2008 and has been listed on the Hochiminh Stock Exchange since July 2009.
The Project is an investment of up to $311 million, consisting of up to $186 million in equity and $125 million in subordinated debt. The investment is expected to help bring about the necessary institutional change to enable the Bank to maintain its leading position and emerge as the countrys premier SME and retail bank, as well as to support the Government of Vietnams privatization plan for the Bank. Along with the investment, IFC plans to provide Vietinbank with advisory services in the areas of corporate governance, SME banking, risk management, energy efficiency financing and information technology.

name.narrative: The Banks headquarters is located in Hanoi, the capital city of Vietnam. In addition to the head office, the Bank also has 3 main operation centers, a network of 155 fully-functioning branches, over 900 transaction and savings offices across all provinces of Vietnam, and nearly 1,300 ATMs. The Bank can make loans throughout the country.
